data.title: Quite a museum
data.text: This quite the museum for a small city like Idaho falls. It has exhibits detailing idahos history back to the conception of the United States. It was very nice as well as a traveling pirates exhibition. The price was a bit steep at 20 something a person otherwise overall a good experience

data.title: A Gem
data.text: After receiving an invitation my friend to visit Idaho Falls, I realized I knew virtually nothing about the state --- except for it's potatoes. If you were in the same category a trip to the museum of Idaho is a must. This little museum is quite impressive. About two thirds of the museum is taken up by rotating exhibits, such as ancient Egypt or the American Revolution. These were well done, but can be found in museums elsewhere. The heart of The museum deals with the relatively short history of the state of Idaho. A real surprise was Idaho's deep involvement with the US nuclear energy program.  Combined with the state's staggering natural beauty, little gems like this museum make Idaho a very interesting vacation destination.

data.title: Worth Every Visit
data.text: For a small time museum, the Museum of Idaho continually puts on a world class exhibit. Many times items displayed are only seen in the big time museums.

data.title: Small but quaint
data.text: I know this is a very small museum  but tells a lot about the very Idaho history.  I found it very interesting and informative.  They were also having a special expedition in regards to the civil war. I thought it was really nice that they had volunteers around the exhibit to explain much more than what you're abou I thought it was really nice that they had volunteers around the exhibit to explain much more than what you're reading about. The whole museum would take approximately an hour and a half to two hours to see, so you can do this and see other things in the area.

data.title: Worth the four-hour drive
data.text: With several history buffs in our family, we had to make the trip for the American Revolution exhibit, and we were not disappointed.  The artifacts and vignettes were fascinating and extremely well organized.  Whoever designed the exhibit has a very cool job and does it with flair.  Even my twelve-year-old daughter who doesn't care about history was surprised that two hours had gone by while she browsed. My favorite parts were the room with photos and short bios of the lesser-known Declaration signers, as well as the poster of quotes by Founding Fathers about other Founding Fathers.  Not always the best of friends, apparently. We didn't leave enough time to visit the smaller, Idaho-specific parts of the museum, so I can't comment on those.

data.title: Very informative
data.text: We went here to see the atomic power exhibits and they were very interesting as was the rest of the museum. What was really surprising was the extensive exhibit on the Revolutionary War. It was excellent.

data.title: Average, needs to be larger
data.text: I have been to many museums in smaller towns in the Western United States and this one rates an "okay".  The staff was helpful.  They need to have more information on Idaho, if they are going to call it the Museum of Idaho.  It was more of early history of the United States with a few small exhibits related to the local area.  Maybe it will be much better, with more history of Idaho, when the early United States history exhibit moves on.  Note there was nothing wrong with the U.S. exhibit, but it was about half the museum when I visited. The many High School students there seemed bored.

data.title: 1776 Exhibit better than Boston museums
data.text: Wow this was an amazing exhibit. In our current election time it reminds us of the heroic endeavors that common men took on and became uncommon men, heroes, and nation builders!

data.title: Enjoyable Experience in Idaho
data.text: The museum had a travelling exhibit that was very educational and interesting. The museum itself also had a nice set of regular exhibits that we enjoyed touring. The layout is nice and the staff was friendly. Definitely a highlight of Idaho Falls and we'll probably visit again.

data.title: Great Museum to learn about Idaho and local area
data.text: If you are in Idaho Falls and have a few spare hours then go to the Museum of Idaho in Idaho Falls.  Great exhibits and staff to help guide you through the museum.  Well worth the time.

data.title: Great Museum
data.text: The current display is "Rebel with a Cause".  It has artifacts and history covering the revolution war.  Very interesting.

data.title: Anniversary
data.text: We went here for the Rebels exhibit, and it was well put together as always!! It didn't take long to get all the way through, but descriptions and volunteers were very helpful in the learning experience!

data.title: Rebels exhibit
data.text: We visited the Museum's Rebels exhibit last week and it was fascinating.  Lots and lots of detail about a period of time in our history that I knew or remembered very little about.  There are volunteers stationed all around that are very knowledgeable and eager to answer questions.  It is not huge like a NYC exhibit but just big enough that you did not get "information overload".  Highly recommend it!

data.title: Great place to visit
data.text: Great place to get to see new displays and have a fun time with family and not spend that much. Kids and teens enjoy it.

data.title: The revolutionary war exhibit is great
data.text: Great visits here. The current exhibit about the revolutionary war was very interesting. Put together in an unusual format and the biography cards at the beginning were fun. Staff was a little over zealous!!

data.title: A nice small museum
data.text: My 2nd visit to this facility. Main attraction currently a display dedicated to the American Revolution called "Rebels with a Cause". Lots of actual artifacts and many well executed reproductions. Has a separate wing dedicated to the history of Idaho. A nice place for history buffs. Small,a visit shouldn't take all day.

data.title: World class in a small city - always top of the line, interesting changing exhibits as well as permanent ones
data.text: they change the exhibits every few months, always very interesting and really world class, we make sure to see them when in town. They bring history and science to life depending on the various exhibits. There is a permanent part about Idaho and then the various ones they put together or bring in for a few months. Cost is very reasonable and well worth it (+ a discount for AAA members with AAA card). When they did the race to the south pole, this was from New York's Museum of natural history and some of the unique items had never been together in any exhibit because they were owned by different organizations and then it went to a big Museum in France to start an international tour. . The current one on Rebels with a cause with artifacts on loan from various owners and the Museum's own items is excellent as well !  In the past they've also done WW2, the Titanic, , dinosaurs (different ones),various science ones like space, Glow (bioluminescence in nature), Ink & Blood (history of the printed/written word).  It is not a big museum but so worthwhile.  A good place to spend time before heading to Yellowstone Park or coming back through. We go when in town for meetings.  The building is interesting too because it houses the historical society. A  part used to be the masonic lodge and the Carnegie library & they connected the 2 separate buildings into one with a big glass enclosure.

data.title: My husband went and said it was very nice
data.text: He loved reading the history of Idaho Falls and seeing the thing is the museum He told me all about the history after his visit.

data.title: Great Museum and Loved the America's Revolution-Rebels with a Cause Exhibit
data.text: Stopped here and paid $9 admission.  I found out it was well worth it as the America's Revolution exhibit which runs to November 26 was great.  Lots of authentic artifacts from the 1600s-1700s on display including letters, guns, military items, etc.  Its an easy two hours and maybe more.  Very interesting, don't miss it if you get the chance to see it.

data.title: Great museum
data.text: We have visited the museum 4-5 times as the shows have changes and have always found it well worth the time. In fact, looking for a weekend foray, we drove from Boise primarily to visit the current show regarding the American Revolution. As always, the docents were friendly, helpful and well informed. They seem to revel in enriching visitors experience at the museum by adding little tidbits of information or by pointing out items of interest which could easily be overlooked. Plan on at least 2 hours to absorb the traveling exhibits and, if you want to take in the permanent Idaho exhibits, add another hour.
